clusters.alerts.archived.title: The cluster is archived!
clusters.alerts.archived.description: This cluster is archived so it's no longer available to submit jobs. You can always make it active to continue using!
clusters.connectivity.conditions.configu: We've successfully connected to your cluster {name}. You can use it for running jobs!
Looks like you have configured your cluster, however it's not reachable!
clusters.connectivity.conditions.unconfi: In order to use this cluster, you need to connect first by providing the Kubernetes configuration!
clusters.resources.cpu.title: CPU Availability
clusters.resources.cpu.description: Showing CPU availability across all nodes
clusters.resources.memory.title: Memory Availability
clusters.resources.memory.description: Showing memory availability across all nodes
clusters.resources.nvidiaGpu.title: Nvidia GPUs Availability
clusters.resources.nvidiaGpu.description: Showing Nvidia GPU slots across all nodes
clusters.nodes.subtitle: Showing the nodes in your Kubernetes cluster
clusters.nodes.noNodes: There are no nodes to show this time. Make sure your configuration is valid!
clusters.noClusters.note: You need to have at least one cluster in your workspace to run jobs.
clusters.create.notice: Create a cluster to run your jobs over.
clusters.messages.testFailed: The cluster configuration is not valid or no enough permissions.
clusters.messages.testSuccess: Successfully connected to the cluster. {nodesCount} nodes are explored.
clusters.placeholders.name: A unique name for your cluster
clusters.placeholders.description: Add a brief desription to your cluster
clusters.placeholders.configuration: Add configuration for your cluster (example: kubeconfig for your K8s cluster)
clusters.update.title: Update the cluster
clusters.update.notice: When updating the name of the cluster please ensure you refer to the new name in job definitions
clusters.configure.title: Configure the cluster
clusters.configure.notice: The updated configuration will be applied only for newly submitted jobs
